Physical Parametrizations¶

group parametrizations

Various functions for physical parametrizations.

Functions

template<class float_t>
float_t polyval2(const double a0, const double a1, const double a2, float_t x)

Evaluate a polynomial

of order 2 using Horner’s method.

Return

Value at x

Parameters

  • a0: Coefficient of the polynomial.

  • a1: Coefficient of the polynomial.

  • a2: Coefficient of the polynomial.

  • x: Value at which to evaluate the polynomial.

template<class float_t>
float_t polyval4(const double a0, const double a1, const double a2, const double a3, const double a4, float_t x)

Evaluate a polynomial

of order 4 using Horner’s method.

Return

Value at x

Parameters

  • a0: Coefficient of the polynomial.

  • a1: Coefficient of the polynomial.

  • a2: Coefficient of the polynomial.

  • a3: Coefficient of the polynomial.

  • a4: Coefficient of the polynomial.

  • x: Value at which to evaluate the polynomial.

of order 6 using Horner’s method.

  • x: Value at which to evaluate the polynomial.

template<class float_t>
float_t latent_heat_water(float_t T, float_t L_wd, float_t cv, float_t cp, float_t T_freeze, float_t R_v, float_t R_a)

Latent heat of vaporization of liquid water in .

Return

Latent heat

Parameters

  • T: Temperature in Kelvin

  • L_wd: Latent heat of evaporation of water (water->vapor)

  • cv: Specific heat capacity of water vapor at constant pressure in

  • cp: Specific heat capacity of air at constant pressure in

  • T_freeze: Lower temperature threshold for raindrop freezing

  • R_v: Gas constant for water vapor, unit in

  • R_a: Gas constant for dry air, unit:

template<class float_t>
float_t particle_mean_mass(const float_t &q, const float_t &n, const float_t &min_x, const float_t &max_x)

Return

Mean mass of particle in kg

Parameters

  • q: Particle mixing ratio [kg/kg]

  • n: Number of particles

  • min_x: Minimum size of particle

  • max_x: Maximum size of particle

template<class float_t>
float_t particle_velocity(const float_t &x, const float_t &a_vel, const float_t &b_vel)

Get diameter of the particle by calculating

with x\f4 the particle mass in kg. Seifert & Beheng; 2006 Eq. (32) @param x Particle mass in kg @param a_geo Coefficient from particle model constant @param b_geo Exponent from particle model constant @return Particle diameter in m */ template <class float_t> inline float_t particle_diameter( const float_t &x, const float_t &a_geo, const float_t &b_geo) { return a_geo * pow(x, b_geo); } /** Get particle velocity of the particle by calculating \f[ a_{\text{vel}} \cdot x^{b_{\text{vel}}} \f] with@_fakenlx\f4 the particle mass in kg. Seifert & Beheng; 2006 Eq. (33)

Return

Particle velocity in

Parameters

  • x: Particle mass in kg

  • a_vel: Coefficient from particle model constant

  • b_vel: Exponent from particle model constant

template<class float_t>
float_t rain_mue_dm_relation(const float_t &D_m, const float_t &cmu0, const float_t &cmu1, const float_t &cmu2, const float_t &cmu3, const float_t &cmu4)

Return

  • cmu0: Parametrization value

  • cmu2: Parametrization value

  • cmu3: Parametrization value

  • cmu4: Parametrization value

Return

  • cmu0: Parametrization value

template<class float_t>
float_t wet_growth_diam(const float_t &p, const float_t &T, const float_t &qw, const float_t &qi, const table_t<float_t> &table)

Calculate the separation diameter for wet growth of supercooled water to ice.

Return

Separation diameter in m

Parameters

  • p: Pressure in Pascal

  • T: Temperature in Kelvin

  • qw: Mixing ratio of rain and cloud water

  • qi: Mixing ratio of ice

  • table: Lookup-table (usually ltabdminwgg)

template<class float_t = codi::RealReverse>

Function for collision integrals of Seifert & Beheng (2006), Eq. 90.

Return

Parameters

  • pc1: Model constants for a particle type that is being collected

  • n: from Eq. 90

template<class float_t = codi::RealReverse>
float_t vent_coeff_a(particle_model_constants_t<float_t> &pc, uint64_t n)

Calculate the model constant of a particle model that is used for vaporization and melting processes with formulas such as

where is the diameter of the particle to melt/vaporize and is the particle velocity. From Seifert & Beheng (2006), Eq. 88.

Return

Parameters

  • pc: Model constants for a particle type

  • n: 1 for cosmo5

template<class float_t = codi::RealReverse>
void init_particle_collection_1(particle_model_constants_t<float_t> &pc1, particle_model_constants_t<float_t> &pc2, collection_model_constants_t<float_t> &c)

Initialize the constants for the particle collection using Seifert & Beheng (2006) Eq. 90-93. This function is for all collections except snow - rain and ice - rain collection.

Parameters

  • pc1: Model constants for a particle type that is being collected

  • pc2: Model constants for a particle type that collects

  • c: Model constants for particle collection

  • pc2: Model constants for a particle type that collects
